item.title: Panic! At The Disco - Into The Unknown
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA Ukulele.
Chords Used: G, D, Bm, Dm, C, F, Dm7, A, D, E, C#m, Cm, Bb
As performed by PANIC! AT THE DISCO, as featured in Disney's FROZEN II
Tutorial Video (GCEA & DGBE): https://youtu.be/YEm7Bj0L1eM
Chord chart ("Tabs") available at: https://ukutabs.com/p/panic-at-the-disco/into-the-unknown/
**************************************
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. Motion video background from https://www.motionbolt.com
Check out the UkeStuff Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Radio Public, Apple Podcasts, Google Play, Spotify, and Stitcher. If you don't have a podcast app, please check out Radio Public for all your podcasts--they support podcasters financially.

item.title: Between the Devil and the Deep Blue Sea Baritone Ukulele Play Along - Baritone Ukulele
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for DGBE ukulele. Keys of G and B.
Chords Used: G, Em, Am, D7, G7, C, Cm, D+, B, Abm, C#m, F#7, A, F, Eb7, C#dim, Em7
Original performance by George Harrison
Our local ukulele group is working on this song, and I was asked to check out the chords they are using (and the tablature they are using), and I made a play along video (there is no tablature in this song).
Tutorial Video (History, GCEA chords, & strumming) on the sister channel (please subscribe!): https://youtu.be/8bll9-iQLW8
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The baritone ukulele chord font is from ukefarm.com.
The Motion background video is from motionbolt.com
Interested in UkeStuff merchandise? https://teespring.com/stores/ukestuff
Check out the UkeStuff Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Radio Public, Apple Podcasts, Google Play, Spotify, and Stitcher.
You are invited to visit my ukulele blog/website, ukestuff.info (free).
Thanks for watching the videos and supporting the channel! Your support of these videos and subscription to the channel makes it possible to produce this content.

item.title: Caspar Babypants - Always Keep a Ukulele in Your Trunk - Baritone Ukulele - Key of A
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for DGBE ukulele. Key of A.
As performed by Caspar Babypants (Chris Ballew), used with permission! (Thanks, Caspar Babypants!)
The image for the video comes from the Kala Brand Instruments website (Kala Ukuleles).
On babypantsmusic.com, Caspar Babypants describes the inspiration for this song:
"I was watching a documentary about George Harrison and in that documentary Tom Petty told a story about George coming to his house to give him a ukulele. George and Tom strolled through the garden playing ukuleles having a grand old time. When George went to leave he asked Tom if he wanted more ukuleles. Tom said he was okay with one ukulele but George insisted and opened the trunk of his car to reveal a HUGE pile of ukuleles. The moment Tom Petty finished telling the story I realized I had to write a song about this incredible moment. I think it's good advice to always keep a ukulele within arms reach! You never know when you need to elevate your mood with the sparkly sound of a uke."
This song is much easier to play on a baritone ukulele than on a soprano/concert/tenor ukulele.
Tutorial video for GCEA ukulele: https://youtu.be/s6Q0aXQq_Eg
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Baritone Ukulele, available at ukefarm.com.
Check out the Ukulele Video Play Along Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Apple Podcasts, Google Play, Spotify, and Stitcher.
And please visit my ukulele blog/website, ukestuff.info (free).
Thanks for watching the videos and supporting the channel! Your support of these videos and subscription to the channel makes it possible to produce this content.

item.title: Caspar Babypants - Always Keep a Ukulele in Your Trunk - Key of A
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of A.
As performed by Caspar Babypants (Chris Ballew), used with permission! (Thanks, Caspar Babypants!)
The image for the video comes from the Kala Brand Instruments website (Kala Ukuleles).
On babypantsmusic.com, Caspar Babypants describes the inspiration for this song:
"I was watching a documentary about George Harrison and in that documentary Tom Petty told a story about George coming to his house to give him a ukulele. George and Tom strolled through the garden playing ukuleles having a grand old time. When George went to leave he asked Tom if he wanted more ukuleles. Tom said he was okay with one ukulele but George insisted and opened the trunk of his car to reveal a HUGE pile of ukuleles. The moment Tom Petty finished telling the story I realized I had to write a song about this incredible moment. I think it's good advice to always keep a ukulele within arms reach! You never know when you need to elevate your mood with the sparkly sound of a uke."
I really like this song for a number of reasons. First, it pays tribute to George Harrison, one of the Beatles. The song also pays tribute in its actual sound, which is reminiscent (to me) to "Yellow Submarine." Second, the song is about ukuleles. Finally, the song offers some opportunities to stretch your playing ability with some more difficult chords (C#min, F#7) and some fingerpicking.
Tutorial video for GCEA ukulele: https://youtu.be/s6Q0aXQq_Eg
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Baritone Ukulele, available at ukefarm.com.
Check out the Ukulele Video Play Along Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Apple Podcasts, Google Play, Spotify, and Stitcher.
And please visit my ukulele blog/website, ukestuff.info (free).
Thanks for watching the videos and supporting the channel! Your support of these videos and subscription to the channel makes it possible to produce this content.

item.description:

item.title: Hugh Jackman - From Now On - Key of A
item.description:
This video was created by the SUNY Fredonia Ukulele Club and is for educational purposes ONLY.
All rights belong to Benj Pasek and Justin Paul.
Chords in this song: A, E, C#m, B
This is the song in it's original key. If you want an easier version to play, go check out this video we made! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wiqK8-BFhkg
Check out our Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/fredoniaukuleleclub
Like our page on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/fredoniaukuleleclub/?ref=aymt_homepage_panel
Strum On!
